concise_definition: adj. 拉伸的, 紧绷的, 延长的; v. 拉伸, 延伸, 伸展（stretch 的过去式和过去分词）

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something that has been pulled or extended beyond its normal or natural length or shape, often to the limit of its elasticity or capacity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某物被拉伸或延展超过其正常或自然的长度或形状，通常达到其弹性或承受能力的极限。
definitions.example_en: The fabric looked worn and stretched after years of use.
definitions.example_cn: 这块布料经过多年的使用后显得磨损且拉伸变形。

definitions.explanation_en: Describing a situation, resource, or system that is being used beyond its normal capacity or limits, often leading to strain or inefficiency.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某种情况、资源或系统被超负荷使用，超出了其正常能力或极限，常导致紧张或效率低下。
definitions.example_en: The hospital staff were stretched thin during the pandemic.
definitions.example_cn: 疫情期间，医院工作人员疲于奔命。

definitions.explanation_en: To extend or pull something so that it becomes longer or thinner, often by applying force.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过施加外力使某物变长或变薄。
definitions.example_en: She stretched the rubber band until it snapped.
definitions.example_cn: 她把橡皮筋拉到它断裂为止。

definitions.explanation_en: To extend the range, scope, or duration of something beyond its usual limits, often to make it cover more than it was designed for.
definitions.explanation_cn: 将某物的范围、范围或持续时间延长至超出其通常的界限，常用于使其覆盖超出原设计的范围。
definitions.example_en: The budget was stretched to cover unexpected expenses.
definitions.example_cn: 预算被勉强用来支付意外开支。

comparison.analysis: “Extended”（延长的）强调时间、空间或范围上的延长，通常不涉及物理形变，更中性、更广泛。例如“extended deadline”（延长的截止日期）。“Stretched”则常隐含过度拉伸、承受压力或接近极限的负面含义，如“stretched resources”（捉襟见肘的资源）。
“Strained”（紧张的）强调因过度使用或压力而产生的紧张、吃力或不自然的状态，常用于人际关系或情绪（如 strained relationship）。“Stretched”更侧重物理或资源上的延展，而“strained”更强调承受压力后的负面后果。两者常可互换，但“strained”更具情感色彩。
“Expanded”（扩展的）指在原有基础上增加规模、范围或容量，通常是积极、有序的增长，如“expanded business”（扩展的业务）。“Stretched”则暗示在没有足够资源或能力的情况下勉强维持，常含勉强、勉强应付的意味，如“stretched thin”（筋疲力尽）。
